Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Brain teaser. I have two coins totaling 15 cents and one of them is not a nickel. What are they?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: A dime and a nickel.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I said one of them is not a nickel.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: But the other one is. I've heard that before.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok. A man and his son get into a car accident. They are rushed to the hospital. The doctor says, there is no way I can operate on this boy, ...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Because he's my son. The doctor is the boy's mother.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A man is found hanging from the ceiling...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: He stepped on a block of ice, hung himself, and the ice melted.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A hunter.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's a polar bear because you're at the North Pole.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn it!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Tell me what you did yesterday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uhhh... nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Nothing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, nothing. How was your day?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I don't care how your day was Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. Well. Ok. I don't care how your day was either, Jan. I was just asking you because you asked me. Why do you set me up like that?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Tell me what you did yesterday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I worked. And then I went home to my condo. And Carol came over. And then we had sex. Is that what you want to hear?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Never ever, ever sleep with your boss. I am so lucky that Jan and I only got to second base.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hi, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'm great. So, Pam I would like you to keep a log of everything Michael does hour by hour so we can analyze it at corporate. Ok?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't know if I'm...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Thanks Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's weird. Jan use to treat Michael like he was a ten year old, but lately it's like he's five.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So you excited?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Very excited?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes. I'm very excited.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Extremely excited? ... Just very? That's cool.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I have spent a year here. I have to commit or get out. Dwight's the top salesman in the company and he's taking me on my first sales call today. And, um, I'm excited.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am very excited. Ryan hasn't made a sale yet, but more importantly, he hasn't made an ally yet. Is he going to be a slacker-loser-wise-ass like Jim was? Or is he going to join the Dwight Army of Champions?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: So what if they're not talking much, then does it makes sense to kind of lead the conversation? You know, just 'till it gets to a point where they are asking questions? [car stops] So where's the sales office?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When you are ready to see the sales office, the sales office will present itself to you. Your journey begins now.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [squeaky chair] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: My chair is squeaking.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is it?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: You took my chair.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I didn't. I took back my chair that you took from me, but I didn't take your chair.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: When you get up, I'm just going to take it back anyway, so...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So I guess I can't get up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Koselli, the Kos. Cosby. Hey hey hey. I love Jello Pudding Pops. My son, Theo, loves Jello Pudding Pops too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you know where we are, temp?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I know where we're not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I hold in my hand, a beet seed. Take it. [Ryan tries to take it, Dwight closes hand] AH! [Ryan tries again and takes seed] When... Damn it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, Big Tuna, can I talk to you for a second.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Can you stand up? And talk to me over there?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: That's it? That's what you came up with?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm acting my heart out here.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, really. You asked for my help, so I helped.

Quote.Speaker: Announcer
Quote.Text: Attention Scranton Business Park, there will be complimentary pretzels in the lobby from now until 4 o'clock as a thank you to our loyal tenants.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Once a year they bring in a little cart and they give away free pretzels. It's really not a big deal. To some people it is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Productivity is important but how can I be productive if I have this one little thing in my brain? That I cannot get out. And that one little thing is a soft pretzel. So I'm just going to have my soft pretzel, then I'll get to work, and I'll be super productive. Look out for me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [looks at long pretzel line] Oh, shhh... Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And just as you have planted your seed in the ground, I'm going to plant my seed in you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't think you know what you're saying.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Smells pretty bad, doesn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's called bull crap and a client can smell it from a mile away.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Gotcha.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh hey, I forgot something in my car. I'll be right back.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ok. [Dwight drives away] Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I wake up every morning in a bed that's too small, drive my daughter to a school that's too expensive, and then I go to work to a job for which I get paid too little, but on Pretzel Day? Well, I like pretzel day.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Because they acted all tough and everything...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: But what they were rapping about was cupcakes and the Chronicles of Narnia. God. Who invented cupcakes, right? I want to...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Phyllis embraces Bob ahead in line] Hey, hey, hey! Phyllis, what are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm just saying hi to Bob.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I think you're cutting in line.

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: Well settle down, Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I'm not going to settle down.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No way.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get in the back please.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Boooooo. Booooo. Back of the line.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Boooooo. Thank you. [hi-five's Stanley]. That's right.

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: What a pair of Mary's.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: This is Pretzel Day.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey Dwight, you're a great salesman. Can you teach me? Sure, Ryan. I'll make you the ole commodor. I'll abandon you in a beet field. Huh. That sounds great, Dwight, I'll really appreciate that. Thank you so much for your mentorship.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Congratulations resourceful salesman. You have passed the second challenge. Welcome to Schrute Farm.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [rocks in squeaky chair]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [sings] Love me, love me, say that you love me, fool me, fool me,

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: stop.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Go on and fool me. Love me, love me, say that you love me

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: This is not fair, this is going to be in my head all day. Please.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: fool me, fool me, go on and fool me. Love me,

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: This is not a proportionate response.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Love me, say that you love me. Fool me, fool me, go on and fool me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't care 'bout anything but you... what ever happened to those guys?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No cuts. Oh, Pam. Just the woman I'd like to see. You read my mind.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great! I thought you could use this time to authorize some checks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I thought that maybe you could wait in line for me while I go to the bathroom. You're an angel.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, why don't you just go up to your office, get some work done, and I'll just bring you a pretzel.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because I like them a certain way, and if it gets screwed up, then whole thing is blown.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know, I just think it's really important that you be productive today.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, productivity starts with patience and determination. I'll be back.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is time for your next test. You have planted the beet seed. You have walked the long lonely walk of loneliness.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Look man, I was in a frat in college. So I know what you're doing. I get it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what your problem is? You know why you haven't made any sales? Cause you think you know everything. You have to trust that maybe there are other people that can teach you things. Are you ready to learn? Are you ready for the final test?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Thank you! [takes pretzel]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi. Please tell me that you have a sweet pretzel left.

Quote.Speaker: Pretzel guy
Quote.Text: We do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank God.

Quote.Speaker: Pretzel guy
Quote.Text: And we have 18 different toppings. We have sweet glaze, cinnamon sugar, chocolate, white chocolate, fudge, M&M's, caramel dip, mint chip, chocolate chip, marshmallow, nuts, toffee nuts, coconuts, peanut butter drizzle, Oreos, sprinkles, cotton candy bits, and powdered sugar.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is there anyway that you could do all, all of them?

Quote.Speaker: Pretzel guy
Quote.Text: The Works. You got it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right! Thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please be seated. [man runs behind Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Who was that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pay no attention to the spirits that haunt this hallowed ground.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Is that your Cousin Mose?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mose is my cousin and he lives here. He will always be my best friend. Unless things go well with Ryan today in which case, I won't hang out with Mose so much anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is the greatest danger facing Dunder Mifflin?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Outsourcing and consolidation of competition.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wrong. Flash floods. What is the true cause of Robert Mifflin's suicide?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Depression?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wrong. He hated himself. What is the DHARMA initiative?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I can't believe that Ryan is not back yet. Where could they be?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Sales take a long time.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God, I'm so worried.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'm sure Dwight will protect him.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't know. Dwight's so weird.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: He's not weird, he's just individualistic.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No, he's a freak.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You're a freak!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Final question, young Ryan Howard. What is Michael Scott's greatest fear?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Um, loneliness. Maybe women.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wrong. He's not afraid of anything. Also, I would have accepted snakes. Fear is what it's all about. You cannot sell while undergoing fear. You need to vanquish fear! One must wrestle fear to the ground. You will now wrestle my cousin Mose.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No. Ok. All right. All right. It's over. This is over. OK.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wrestle him to the ground.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, you're a freak. I'm not doing this anymore. This is over. Goodbye.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ryan. Don't. Ryan! You don't have to wrestle him. Just get in the coffin. Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Cousin Mose
Quote.Text: Bye, Ryan. He seemed nice.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where are all the animals?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ryan, come on. I am sorry. I am sorry. Mose is sorry too. Look, he sent over a basket with eggs and some fat back bacon. And look, something he whittled.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You still mad? It's just Jim and I didn't get along, and I didn't want it to be that way again. You know, I wanted us to be a team. An unstoppable team that competed against other teams.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Look, that, that's not what I wanted, ok. I just wanted to go on a sales call.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Screwgun. The sales call!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [Michael is listening to "Rock And Roll Part 2 by Gary Glitter" and everyone can hear it. Kevin singing in unison with the song] Hey! Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mr. Kosseli. Hey hey hey, the Cos. What's going on? Do we have a deal? Deal or no deal? Let's make a deal. So what is the deal?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Establish time frames. Keep the phrase "real dollars" in their head. And always keep the power in the conversation. That's why you're losing them on the cold calls. Cause you say the word please too much.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Wait, can you go back?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael always said, K.I.S.S. Keep it simple, stupid. Great advice, hurts my feelings every time.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ok, I'm going to establish time frames.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm going to put everything in terms of "real dollars".

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm going to ask a lot of questions that all have sort of positive answers.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Saying, that would be better, or we would like that. That sort of thing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Exactly. Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm going to try to be confident, but not cocky.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! Hey! Everyone, I am officially streamlining the efficiency of this corporation. Second...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, second, Toby. Second, I am insisting on increased accountability from every single one of you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Account...? Michael, what is going on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I will be taking questions.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did you have a lot of sugar today, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What's on your suit?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Carmel Dip. But, one question at a time please. Phyllis, Stanley. I want you to switch desks, I'm going to reorganize and restructure the physical layout of the office to maximize everything! I think we're getting a lot done, don't you? On paper at least. And we are, after all, a paper company. Are we not, are we not, are we not? Are you with me, are you with me? Thank you very much!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: They really didn't like me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They did not. They didn't have to say it to your face.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't get it. I don't get what I did wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not everything's a lesson, Ryan. Sometimes you just fail. It's those online paper jerks. The whole business is changing. You know what? They're going to be screwed once this whole internet fad is over. What are you doing? [Ryan throws egg at building] Oh no no no no! Ryan! Yes! Ryan the temp! Come on! Courtesy of Dunder Mifflin. Come on! Drive.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You drive.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Pam. Oh, hi Jan. He's, uh, on a sales call. No message? Bye, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Dwight chokes as Ryan downs a beer in one drink] Temp! Temp! Temp! Temp! Ryan! Ryan! Ryan! Ryan! Yes! Just think, that temp agency could have sent you anywhere.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I think about that all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Night, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Night.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, what time is it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: 20 past 5.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: AM or PM?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: PM.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: These came for you. Contracts? Brent Koselli?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Koselli. With the Jello.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is a huge sale.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Right. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Night, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Goodnight!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [phone rings] Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry, I forgot Kevin's extension. It's a fantasy football thing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I was just going to go through the system cause I didn't think you'd be there. Why, why are you still there?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I had to work late. Jan's making me keep a log of everything Michael does all day.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. Do you think you could send me a copy of that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, totally. So...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry. Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, no, I um. Everything's pretty much the same here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A little different. What time is it there?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What time is it here? Um, we're in the same time zone.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. Right.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How far away did you think we were?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know. It felt far.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. I have a question for you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How many words per minute does the average person type?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I type 90.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Shut up. Mavis Beacon doesn't even type 90.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's true.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, I said average.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: 70? How many do you type?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Forget it. I was just about to brag but forget it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Come on. Tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You have to tell me now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: 65. Ok, no need to laugh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, it's, that's respectable.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Respectable?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So ok. I'm watching the movie, by myself...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because I just wanted a relaxing evening at home...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And, I'm freaking out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That movie is so scary!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But I'm holding on because I keep waiting for Sandra Bullock to show up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No way. How do you confuse 28 Days with 28 Days Later?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because I got it at Blockbuster and they don't put the pictures on the box.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, you're making this up!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Would I make that up?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes. Fancy New Beesley would make that up. New apartment, new stories.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, in my fancy new apartment. I have one bedroom, one bathroom, and a closet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And how many kitchens?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I have one kitchen.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, you got totally taken for a ride Beesley.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's actually...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Most apartments these days have like three.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Three kitchens?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes! How are you going to cook every meal of the day in one kitchen?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Ryan and Dwight enter] Hey, Ryan, are you ok?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um. Ok, bye.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, I should, I should, I should probably go too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I was um...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, no no.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You have to go?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, uh, well.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I should probably go too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I mean, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Bye Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Bye Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Three hundred and sixty four days, 'till the next Pretzel Day.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: What I want, Michael, is an hour-by-hour log of how you spend your work time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, that's really not the way I roll, because sometimes I'm in the zone, and sometimes I'm in the zoning out.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Zoning out?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you want me to go on Amazon and order you a slang dictionary? Cause I'll do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: If you can account for your time...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, big if.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: ...then maybe corporate can justify your salary.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A woman spurned.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's like mommy and daddy are fighting. Except mommy outranks daddy and mommy is way scarier.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Take a good look at this boy...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I always do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...because you are never going to see him again.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you lay a finger...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Today is Ryan's first sales call and I am bringing this boy home a full-grown man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Would you look at that? [Hugs Ryan] [Dwight attempts hug] Damn it, Dwight! Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight is taking Ryan on a sales call today. So if we find Ryan's body in a heavily-wooded area tomorrow, I owe Jim $30. It's an old bet, but a deal's a deal.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I once saw a movie called "Training Day". It starred an African-American and Ethan Hawke. In it, the African-American trains Ethan Hawke with various tests and trials. Today, Ryan is Ethan Hawke, and I am the African-American.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get in the car.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't have a key.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't you realize the key is inside you? [pretends to pull key out of Ryan's ear]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: He's the top salesman at the company. He's the top salesman at the company. He's the top salesman at the company. Today's gonna be great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, but seriously, your ears are the key. 90% of a good sales call is listening, only 10% is talking.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Huh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get in the car. [Ryan knocks the car door] Get... get in the car.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sales is not all in here. [wails arms] It's also in here.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What was that first thing you did?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [wails arms] You know, selling, typing, dialing.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is that in your ear? [pretends to pull beet seed out of Ryan's ear] A tiny beet seed. You need to clean your ears better.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's going okay. I've already learned more about beet agriculture than I ever thought I'd know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "9:00 to 10:00, checked in with receptionist. Met with Jan, RE:

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You know, every time I think I hit rock bottom at my job, the floor opens up, like at a carnival ride. I'm gonna retrace my steps. College, four-year degree, student loans, business school, alone in a beet field. I... there's a step missing. "Hey, mom." "Hey, Ryan. How's that five-year plan coming?" "Oh, it's great. Today, I knelt down in cow manure and I got abandoned in a beet field." "Oh, that's cool." "Yeah, that's really cool. I'm learning a lot. I'm really glad I took this full-time job."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sales is about people, Ryan. About understanding them and learning how to get along with them. Case study:

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [in the kitchen and Stanley comes in and swipes Kevin's pretzel without Kevin seeing] Shoot.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: There's four things that I love. My wife, my daughters, Pam Grier, and a hot, chewy roll of buttered dough.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What makes them so good?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I do not know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I mean, they're just dough twisted up with some candy. They taste so good in my mouth.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That's what she said. [Stanley and Michael both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Look, I've never seen a Clint Eastwood movie.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: See, that's weird.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: But if you said "Go ahead, make my day," I would know that it's from "Dirty Harry". How can you not know that's from "Ferris Bueller's Day Off"?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yo, mama! Ask me how bad I wanted to bone Jennifer Grey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I saw the movie. I just don't know every line from the film.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Seriously, you guys, ask me.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: You didn't know that "Bueller?" was from Ferris Bueller?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let's just say, me and Jennifer Grey probably would've broken a few laws.
